org.apache.reef.task

Interface Task

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EchoTask, FailTask, FailTaskCall, FailTaskClose, FailTaskMsg, FailTaskStart, FailTaskStop, FailTaskSuspend, HelloTask, LineCountingTask, NoopTask, NoopTask, ShellTask, SleepTask, StatePassingTask, SuspendTestTask, TaskMessagingTask

    public interface Task
    The interface for Tasks.

    This interface is to be implemented for Tasks.

    The main entry point for a Task is the call() method inherited from Callable. The REEF Evaluator will call this method in order to run the Task. The byte[] returned by it will be pushed to the Job Driver.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] call(byte[] memento)
      Called by the resourcemanager harness to execute the task.

    • Method Detail

      • call

        byte[] call(byte[] memento)
            throws Exception
        Called by the resourcemanager harness to execute the task.
        Parameters:
        memento - the memento objected passed down by the driver.
        Returns:
        the user defined return value
        Throws:
        Exception - whenever the Task encounters an unsolved issue. This Exception will be thrown at the Driver's event handler.
